intro: Scalia jaceoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf scalia, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight fragrance. Scalia jaceoides is typically found in moist, open habitats like meadows and woodlands.
